definition: continuously arising/to arise repeatedly
alternately/repeatedly

to rise/to raise/to get up/to set out/to start/to appear/to launch/to initiate (action)/to draft/to establish/to get (from a depot or counter)/verb suffix, to start/starting from (a time, place, price etc)/classifier for occurrences or unpredictable events: case, instance/classifier for groups: batch, group
each new high point replaced by another/(of a movie etc) one climax after another

sentences.english: There are multiple ways for women to have multiple orgasms.
sentences.chinese: 讓女人高潮迭起的方法不盡相同。

sentences.english: I lowered my head silence, until around cheering happened frequently.
sentences.chinese: 我低着頭沉默，直到周圍歡呼聲迭起。

sentences.english: The houses of parliament have had a long and violent history.
sentences.chinese: 英國議會大廈的歷史十分悠久而且風雲迭起。

definition: uninhibited/free and unconstrained/rhythmical
see 此起彼伏[ci3 qi3 bi3 fu2]
to spring up everywhere/from all around
to surge like a gathering storm (idiom)/to grow by leaps and bounds
brilliant and varied/(often in the combination 精彩纷呈)
lit. fire beacons in all four directions (idiom); the confusion of war
one climax follows another (of thrilling story)
changeable situation (idiom)
to arise again/to make a comeback/resurgence
unrest (social or political)/turmoil/upheaval/commotion
the fire of war in all four directions (idiom); the confusion of war
variant of 跌宕[die1 dang4]

up here, down there (idiom); to rise and fall in succession/no sooner one subsides, the next arises/repeating continuously/occurring again and again (of applause, fires, waves, protests, conflicts, uprisings etc)
to follow on sb's heels
fire beacons on all sides (idiom); enveloped in the flames of war
numerous and disorderly
